metadata.Title: CVE-2022-26384 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium
metadata.Description: If an attacker could control the contents of an iframe sandboxed withallow-popups but not allow-scripts, they wereable to craft a link that, when clicked, would lead to JavaScript executionin violation of the sandbox. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 98,Firefox ESR < 91.7, and Thunderbird < 91.7. Update Instructions: Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-26384` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions: firefox - 1:1snap1-0ubuntu1 No subscription required thunderbird - 1:91.7.0+build2-0ubuntu1 thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:91.7.0+build2-0ubuntu1 thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:91.7.0+build2-0ubuntu1 xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:91.7.0+build2-0ubuntu1 xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:91.7.0+build2-0ubuntu1 xul-ext-lightning - 1:91.7.0+build2-0ubuntu1 No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:1snap1-0ubuntu1').
thunderbird package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:91.7.0+build2-0ubuntu1').
mozjs78 package in lunar is affected and may need fixing.
